{{cpp/string/basic_string/title|back}}
{{cpp/string/basic_string/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl|num=1|notes={{mark constexpr since c++20}}|
CharT&amp; back();
}}
{{dcl|num=2|notes={{mark constexpr since c++20}}|
const CharT&amp; back() const;
}}
{{dcl end}}

Returns reference to the last character in the string. The behavior is undefined if {{lc|empty()}} is {{c/core|true}}.

===Parameters===
(none)

===Return value===
Reference to the last character, equivalent to {{c|operator[](size() - 1)}}.

===Complexity===
Constant.

===Notes===
In libstdc++, {{tt|back()}} is [https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/libstdc++/manual/strings.html#strings.string.shrink not available] in C++98 mode.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::string s("Exemplary");
    char&amp; back1 = s.back();
    back1 = 's';
    std::cout &lt;&lt; s &lt;&lt; '\n'; // "Exemplars"
    
    std::string const c("Exemplary");
    char const&amp; back2 = c.back();
    std::cout &lt;&lt; back2 &lt;&lt; '\n'; // 'y'
}
|output=
Exemplars
y
}}
